attributes.action: Legislate against the preaching of religious beliefs in public places
attributes.background:
Individuals/groups take it upon themselves to publicly preach their religion and messages of damnation and condemnation of others for their actions. This creates hostility in our streets and needs to stop!

Let's move this country towards an enlightened and civilised world without religion.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government must allow all its citizens to believe or not believe in any religion they choose and not be subject to preaching from others. 
These preachers publicly shame and condone others for living their lives as they wish and should not be heard on our streets.
This does not restrict the right to free speech as there are many faith zones where they can meet others and speak about their beliefs with those that share them.

attributes.action: Make teaching 'Children's Rights' compulsory in all schools.
attributes.background: There are a list of more than 40 rights, which each child has. Most children don't even know these rights exist. Teaching children's rights in schools will inform all children of the rights they have.

attributes.action: Stop Private Railway Operators from wheel clamping under Railway Byelaw14
attributes.background: Vehicle clamping by private companies was deemed illegal in England and Wales in October 2012. However, Private Railway Operators can still legally exploit an old Railway Byelaw(14) which allows them to continue an aggressive campaign against railway passengers parking in their car parks.
attributes.additional_details:
They enlist private Contractors to handle this duty, and as a result, are generating thousands of pounds in revenue from excessive use of wheel clamping and by applying disproportionate penalties and release costs, for aggressive commercial gain.

Its time this ended, so please sign this petition if you believe the Department of Transport should take action, to ensure Railway Operators and their private clamping Contractors have to abide by the same Laws as anywhere else in the Country.

attributes.action: parliament make a law. No levy on diesel cars before park & ride system in place
attributes.background:
As an asthmatic i find towns with no Park & Ride, such as Southampton, cause irritation to the lung,s.
It is irresponsible  not to provide the facilities for shopper & visitor traffic to park outside the city.
We cannot clean up air quality, if we just encourage more & more vehicle,s into Towns

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement to fill out military medical forms within 48 hours.
attributes.background: Military applicants rely on their doctor to fill out a medical form involving medical history of the applicant. However doctors tend to sit on this paperwork for weeks, delaying the applicants entry process (which is very frustrating).
attributes.additional_details: Doctors get payed by the army, navy, airforce to fill these forms out and still sit on them for weeks even though many forms come with an urgent warning.

attributes.action: Make Business Studies, Life Skills and Politics mandatory at Secondary School.
attributes.background: In school there is no direct focus on skills that children need to truly succeed in life. Business Studies is taken an optional subject when really we should be teaching our children how to be entrepreneurial, this would help children gain essential critical thinking skills to help them grow.
attributes.additional_details: There is so much opportunity that is potentially being wasted by not equipping children with the skills and knowledge to get on in life. Children should have a knowledge of politics, business, how to get a mortgage. Children should know who the Prime Minister of this country is and how laws are made. If we want our country to be set up for success we should invest in our children as they will invest in the country themselves.

attributes.action: Get Britain to join the North Atlantic Free Trade Area
attributes.background: Britain has left the undemocratic and overbearing EU but we still need to trade with the rest of the world.  So lets join NAFTA and not have to worry about a NAFTA parliament or "ever closer integration".

attributes.action: Give long term partners the same inheritance rights as a spouse
attributes.background: I lost my partner of 25 years, we owned a home and a business together. When he died without leaving a will I had to buy his share of our business, home and buy all of his belongings at the full market value from his only son. I was not financially dependent on him and therefore had no entitlement.

attributes.action: I would like the Government to reinstate Child Support Agency!
attributes.background: We need a government run Child Support Agency as the so called Child Maintenance Service is not meeting the correct criteria. Causing a high level of financial suffering for the parent who is raising the child/children. The absent parent is not being forced to supply correct financial  information.

attributes.action: Keep the BARRED list, scrap the DBS - help people with convictions get jobs.
attributes.background: Prison, fine or anything other than the lifetime of the DBS which prevents many  British people (not so much foreign nationals) from working, as teachers or within the NHS. It is obvious that the British poor tend to be affected.
attributes.additional_details: It will in the long run cause a deficit in British society as more British people are thrown on to the (never get a job heap).

attributes.action: Demand that better aid be provided for countries in need of clean and safe water
attributes.background: This petition is in opposition to the decisions to divert funding from aid made leaders of international development from the UK. Help secure the well being and livelihoods for some the 650 million people (10 times the British population) worldwide who live without something as vital as safe water.
attributes.additional_details:
Many NGOs such as WaterAid fear that the approach to foreign aid made by current British Secretary of State for International Development, Priti Patel, will heavily damage the support that the world's poorest people desperately have to receive. It is imperative that this is corrected the current aid work can have long term, meaningful effect.

https://www.theguardian.com/global-development-professionals-network/2016/sep/14/uk-ngos-raise-concerns-about-priti-patels-new-approach-to-foreign-aid

attributes.action: Where possible, make it policy for cars used by all authorities, be British made
attributes.background: It only seems logical for cars used by the police force, or even any other public body, buy cars with the vast majority of their supply chain in Britain - as long as the car serves that particular purpose and is cost effective. Not only does it decrease a carbon footprint, it safeguards an industry.

attributes.action: Stop all aid to Countries with active hostility towards the United Kingdom
attributes.background: The Foreign Office has advised that it has no intention to stop aid to North Korea. A country openly hostile to the UK and a country which routinely threatens to attack the UK and it's allies. Sending aid to such countries while people are homeless in the UK is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Stop the government from scrapping A-Level Citizenship.
attributes.background: A-level citizenship is a course that offers hundreds of students a chance to learn about politics, law and sociology without getting into too much depth. It's a much-needed course and the government should be helping to teach people how to be a good citizen instead of removing the subject.

attributes.action: Make pharmaceutical company's government run, putting profit into health care.
attributes.background: We the undersigned petition the British government, to take control of the pharmaceutical industry. Put profits into health care and allow natural products to be tested that other company's won't test, as they can't hold a patent on natural products. Also to put this to United Nations. Saving lives.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of health care would drastically drop, if a cap on profit were made in this industry. Jobs would not be lost, as the work would still need to be done! Live would be saved as this would become affordable.

attributes.action: Transfer the drug cannabis from class B to class C
attributes.background: In January 2004, cannabis was transferred from class B to class C and was reclassified in January 2009 as a class B drug, which went against the ACMD's advice on the classification of the drug. Classifying cannabis as a class C drug would save the police both time and money.

attributes.action: make it illegal for holiday companies to book children on holidays in term time
attributes.background: The Supreme Court has ruled it is illegal to take children on holidays in term time.  The government should be going after the travel companies not the parents.  I would like to petition the government to make it illegal for travel companies to book children on holidays during term time.

attributes.action: Raise the tax rate on all meat being imported into the UK by 25%
attributes.background: In order to discourage people from buying ethically wrong, unhealthy and environmentally damaging meat, this petition calls for the current tax rate on meat products being imported into the United Kingdom to be increased by 25%.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information on why this bill is necessary, try visiting these two pages:

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/men/thinking-man/11761701/We-all-need-to-stop-eating-meat-now-and-this-is-why.html

https://www.vegsoc.org/goveggie

attributes.action: HMG has significant forces in FRG. Gov. to debate redeploying BFG to Gibraltar.
attributes.background: HM Government at some considerable cost to the British taxpayer maintains a significant military presence in Germany in the form of British Forces Germany (BFG).  Germany is the richest EU country and not being directly threatened or indeed sited adjacent any potential hostile nation.
attributes.additional_details: In light of the EU's response to our PM's Article 50 notification, and in view of Germany not being directly threatened or indeed sited adjacent any potential hostile nation, Parliament should debate the redeployment of significant elements of BFG from Germany to potential conflict zones where British interests at likely to be directly threatened e.g. Gibraltar.  The German Government freed from the comforting cloak of foreign protective power might then be stimulated to pay for its own defence.

attributes.action: EU immigrants arriving after article 50 must return home when we leave the EU
attributes.background: Immigrants who arrive after article 50 starts must return home once we fully leave the EU

attributes.action: Increase 1% pay rise given to Armed Forces and NHS to a minimum of 2%
attributes.background:
Serving members of the British Armed Forces will face the "perfect storm" of below-inflation pay rises, rising taxes and the prospect of increased rents.

It comes as Politicians receive a 1.4% increase, the equivalent of over £1000 a year for most, and NHS workers also receive the measly 1%.

attributes.action: Remove the requirement and fine DVLA imposes for renewing photo every 10years.
attributes.background: DVLA promoted photo licence - with paper counterpart to allow people to access services for themselves, to make it easier & join up insurance with licensing for car ease of car taxation. Now they have removed counterparts & made you an illegal driver by imposing a 10 year renewal period.
attributes.additional_details: Aging ten years has only slight changes to the appearance of a person. The ability to drive is improved with experience, not reduced, until later life, and that is only if certain ailments are effected. DVLA is purely generating income here, when they purported to decease the cost of motoring to the tax payer & give ease of access. Would ANYONE have changed from a paper licence had they been informed?

attributes.action:
Stop people starving to death instead of renovating the
Houses of Parliament
attributes.background: The world is currently facing one of the worst humanitarian crisis in history. 20 million people across Africa are facing starvation. In the UK, government is proposing spending in excess of 3.5 billion on renovating parliament. These funds would be better spent preventing loss of life.
attributes.additional_details:
Clearly a building is needed, and alternative sites have been suggested both inside and outside of London. Parliament is a magnificent building, but repairs to a building simply cannot be prioritised over people's lives. 

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/treasury-select-committee-mps-inquiry-palace-of-westminster-renovation-parliament-commons-lords-a7527976.html

https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/mar/11/world-faces-worst-humanitarian-crisis-since-1945-says-un-official

attributes.action: Legally mandate all large vehicles to have an external CCTV system
attributes.background: Too many cyclists and pedestrians are being killed on Britain's roads by large vehicles and busses. This is an especially big problem in London where to date 18 people have been killed on the roads, at least 7 of those by lorries or coaches. The technology is available and cheap enough to install.
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see the government make it a legal requirement for all vehicles with a wheelbase greater than 2 metres, or with obstructed view (i.e. small vans and transit vans) to be fitted with external camera systems with visual displays in the cab. This would provide 360 degree visibility to the driver helping prevent needless deaths on our roads. Rear stickers warning of a vehicle's blind spot are a clear admission that they are dangerous and not fit for purpose, and are not good enough.

attributes.action: Motorbikers rights are taught to learner car drivers
attributes.background: When learner drivers of cars are taking lessons it is not currently mandatory that the discussion is had about the rights motorbikers have when filtering and overtaking. This causes drivers to be careless, cause accidents injuries & deaths of bikers for doing what is there right, to filter traffic.
attributes.additional_details: When legally filtering down two lanes of traffic, cars will quite often swap lanes without looking not knowing a bike could be traveling between the lanes. Car drivers will quite often believe the bike is at fault because they do not know the laws of filtering. Bikers also have the right to filter to the front of traffic. Car drivers get angry and often verbally and physically attack bikers that are overtaking them in traffic not believing they have the right. Education of learners is the key.

attributes.action: Relocate Naval defence contracts out of Scotland to ensure UK's future security
attributes.background: Continued anti UK anti Westminster rhetoric by SNP shows their everlasting unwillingness to be part of the UK. This attitude/intent could compromise the effectiveness of UK Naval Defence strategy.  Future dependable security is only assured if Naval facilities/contracts are south of the border.

attributes.action: Get Scotland its independence without a referendum
attributes.background: The Prime Minister has blocked any referendum for the people of Scotland.  Since when did the PM know what the Scottish people want.  She clearly does not.
attributes.additional_details: We the Scottish people have been lied to by Westminster.  Westminster lied to us about our oil running out.  We are being dragged out of the EU against our will.  Scotland was told it would have new powers and still nothing.  We the Scottish people want our Independence.

attributes.action: Call a UK wide referendum on Scottish independence by the end of 2018.
attributes.background: I believe more people in England would like Scotland to become an independent nation than those in Scotland itself.
attributes.additional_details: Each year Scotland spends more than its entire GDP, this overspend is covered by the rest of the UK, by making Scotland leave the UK the rest of the UK will gain billions of pounds which could be spent more wisely.

attributes.action: Review what constitutes a conflict of interests for MPs with second jobs.
attributes.background: Public confidence in politicians is threatened by MPs taking second jobs, especially where a clear conflict of interests exists, such as editing a newspaper. How can a serving MP adequately and objectively represent their constituents while they have a commitment to other work? We need clarity.
attributes.additional_details: Recently two MPs resigned to take up other work: Tristram Hunt to become director of the Victoria and Albert Museum; and Jamie Reed to take up a post at Sellafield. With the news that George Osborne, serving MP for Tatton, has become editor of the Evening Standard yet has not resigned, the public needs clarity on which sectors outside parliament, if any, it is acceptable for serving MPs to work in, and what creates a conflict of interest between MPs' work for constituents and another employer?

attributes.action: Demand the US Government formally apologise over the allegations of wiretapping.
attributes.background:
The White House has accused GCHQ of illegally spying on Donald Trump at the behest of President Obama.

The UK Government should demand, in the strongest terms, either tangible proof of this or a formal apology.

attributes.action: Use Road Equivalent Tariff (as used for Scottish Ferry fares) for Rail Fares.
attributes.background: It is cheaper for two people to travel in their own car rather than by train on some journeys. Rail fares should be cheaper than taking a car, encouraging less car use.
attributes.additional_details:
Typical journey Forres to Aberdeen 78 miles  

single rail fare for couple (2 at £23.20) = £46.40

typical total cost by car (ref AA) 78miles at £0.40 = £31.20

attributes.action: At least 75% of the population need to vote for change in a referendum
attributes.background: Refrendums have been very devisive and it seems ludicrous  that it can be decided by a single vote either way. If 75% of the population don't vote for change then the status quo should be upheld. It has led to the nation being split  following the Brexit vote and Scottish Indy vote 1, 2 or more.

attributes.action: By-elections enforced for breaking election expenses rules
attributes.background: To enforce a Parliamentary by-election where the existing winning candidate breaks election expenses rules. Also to include additional fines and possible banning of that Party from standing in that by-election.
attributes.additional_details:
With the Conservative Party being fined £70,000 for recent breaches, as well as others, it is clear that free and fair elections are no more than a myth and that such actions undermine the democratic process.

This petition demands that breaches of electoral expenses by the winning candidate will require an immediate by-election, the possibility of fines amounting to several times the value of the breach and the banning of the Party in breach from standing in that by-election.

attributes.action: Raise minimum wage for night shift workers.
attributes.background: Working nights are unsociable hours, to be paid day minimum wage is wrong.  Working nights is unhealthy but someone has to do the job, by upping the nights minimum wage will help the jobs get done and the staff happier. Please help to up the minimum wage for night workers.
attributes.additional_details: Nights staff are always needed but the day minimum wage is not enough to compensate the lack of sleep and mess of routine.

attributes.action: Divert all foreign aid immediately to the looming famine in East Africa
attributes.background: We have money for the Ethiopian Spice Girls, the Indian Space Programme and the largest economy in the world. More people are going to die than ever before on Earth. We are the greatest country in the world. We must show the world that we in this Island will do the the right thing, now and forever.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to guarantee rights for EU nationals living in the UK
attributes.background: MPs have voted against an amendment that would have guaranteed rights for EU nationals living in the U.K. It's a disgrace. They have been beneficial members of our society, partaking in jobs that we don't want to, bringing expertise and contributing towards the economy.
attributes.additional_details: I'm calling on the government to hold a referendum over this matter, in regards to guaranteeing rights for EU nationals in the U.K., as we enter the negotiations stage.

attributes.action: Greater approbation of open dialogue in mental health context.
attributes.background: Open dialogue restores mental health more effectively than with conventional psychiatric drugs.  Originating in Finland in the 80's it has a proven track record of curing70% of their clients with little or no drugs fewer relapses no need for hospital beds , no expensive bill for medication.

attributes.action: Make benefit claimants do 10 hours free work a week to help community projects.
attributes.background: As the government keeps on cutting money for councils, they have an ever growing problem of finding additional funds to do community projects. Therefore some tasks are no longer undertook by the council like they once were. This can be seen from local parks to general litter picking.
attributes.additional_details: Solving this would be to enforce that people who recieve benefits would be required to undertake 10hrs free work a week to recieve their benefits. It would help the community and also give experience to the people whom recieve them. The people whom claim benefits would have to be accessed to see if they are capable and fit to undetake the tasks of the community.

attributes.action: Award Diabeties Mellititus Type 1 sufferers the Personal Independent Plan.
attributes.background: Many diabetics are being refused the PIP because they no longer reach the criteria the government have set. Yet they were awarded the Disbility Living Allwance. My son is diabetic, and recently was refused dispite going to tribunal and being on the autistic spectrum.
attributes.additional_details: There is a new blood testing system for diabetics. It is a system that is pain free. A patch is applied to the body and a small scanner is used to record mp the blood sugars. It costs just under £60 for one patch that lasts for two weeks. It is not free in the NHS

attributes.action: Close down schools that breach the Equality Act.
attributes.background: There are schools that teach homophobia, sexism and racism under the guise of 'religion'. This is indoctrination and harassment, directly in breach of the Equality Act. It creates a hostile environment for children and attacks protected characteristics. This is breaking the law.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/editorials/illegal-faith-schools-education-ofted-a7587621.html
Any school that is breaking the Equality Act is an 'illegal school'. All schools need to be rigorously inspected. Downgrading them is not enough. They need to change or be closed. They are breaking the law.
http://www.pinknews.co.uk/2016/12/21/christian-schools-downgraded-by-ofsted-over-homophobic-teachings/

attributes.action: Make football available across all viewing platforms at reasonable cost
attributes.background: In 2007 the European Union demanded that Premier League football TV rights be split to end the monopoly that BSkyB had over televised football in the UK. They said the new system would provide football fans with "greater choice and better value". In reality the opposite has happened.
attributes.additional_details: Football fans are now having to pay for two subscriptions in order to watch all the available matches. This hardly provides better value and is leading to the increase in illegal online streaming of matches. We would ask the government to look at this ruling, especially with the impending UK exit from the European Union, and ask that all rights holders make their HD channels available to each other on a wholesale basis to end the current system of needing two expensive subscriptions.

attributes.action: Repeal the Fixed Term Parliaments Act 2011
attributes.background: The Fixed Term Parliaments Act should be repealed immediately to allow an opportunity to call a snap election. With several obstacles on the horizon for the government, a general election will most likely strengthen its hand and reaffirm the voters support and representation.

attributes.action: Stop taxpayers money from being spent on translators and interpreters in the UK
attributes.background: It's nothing new that millions of pounds of taxpayers money is spent each year for migrants who don't speak English. The huge sum of money is spent in hospitals and courts among other places on translators and interpreters for migrants who come to the UK and don't speak English.

attributes.action: Make it that only UK elected officials can vote on legislation before Parliament
attributes.background: When The House of Commons, comprising of publicly elected MPs, debate, and vote in favour of any legislation, The House of Lords, which is a totally unelected body, should not be able to reject, amend, or interfere with said legislation, in any way, other than in an advisory capacity.

attributes.action: Make father's who have DNA test automatically on birth certificate
attributes.background: Some mothers are scared if they put the father's on birth certificates then they have less rights but no matter what for the benefit of that child both parents should be on the birth certificate and father's should still need to prove their parenting via contact centres etc
attributes.additional_details: I have seen to many devoted fathers with no rights whatsoever it isn't fair in this day and age, we all have the right to be equal and every child deserves to know who brought them into this world, this is the only flaw in our system in this situation we all have a point to prove ourselves and thats what contact centres are in place for worried parents of their ex partners for different reasons and background checks go into parents for to see who these people are

attributes.action: UK Government to encourage President Trump to visit Birmingham
attributes.background: Donald Trump defied all of the odds and is now the president for the United States. Unlike London, Birmingham voted to leave and played a huge part in the Brexit vote. Donald will save us from Brexit thanks to his trade deals.Leave means leave and Trump mean Trump. Lets MAKE BIRMINGHAM GREAT AGAIN!
attributes.additional_details: Birmingham is the second biggest city and one of the most diverse.

attributes.action: All new cars sold in Britain must have a phone kits installed.
attributes.background: Using mobile phones while driving is seriously dangerous and damages lives. Why can’t the government put in a simply law in place, to make all car manufactures install phone kits in to any new sold car. This could possibly save a lot of lives and save even more injuries.

attributes.action: Curb betting adverting around football matches and ban impulse bets.
attributes.background:
A ban should be placed on betting advertising within 30 minutes of the start of football matches; and a ban should be placed on in play and 'impulse' bets and their aggressive advertising.
Firms should be forced to allow 1 minute cooling off period on all bets to stop people betting impulsively
attributes.additional_details:
Since legalisation of advertising for betting in the U.K. we have seen an increase in problematic gambling, coinciding with the rise of betting on apps and the subsequent increase in advertising spend. New demographics are targeted, the industry now intertwined with football and is impossible to ignore.
Companies are now failing in their duty of care to their customers by providing quicker and quicker ways to bet, alongside aggressively advertising odds to encourage impulsive betting patterns.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all public officers to undertake ethics testing
attributes.background: A recent Freedom of Information request revealed that despite the publication by Central Government in 1995 of the Nolan Principles binding the conduct of all public office holders, no records currently exist in the Cabinet Office of routine ethics testing carried out across our public services
attributes.additional_details:
Sound ethical judgement is critical in attaining and maintaining public and business trust in our public services.

Whilst this argument was underpinned by the Nolan Principles in 1995, the Cabinet Office can't actually evidence today any records of routine ethics testing by staff across the population to which such principles are supposed to apply.

In today's digitally connected economy where e-tools exist to audit ethics awareness, this finding is unacceptable and can easily be addressed.

attributes.action: Make fast, MANDATORY  PIP awards to cancer patients already on lower PIP
attributes.background: Cancer patients already awarded PIP for existing illnesses have to chance losing what they have already been awarded by having to make a completely new claim when diagnosed with Cancer. Enough stress comes with Cancer without having to worry about finances and the potential loss of income.
